item.title: 大洋控股收到 KKR 等公司的收购建议书
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，日本化学品制造商大洋控股公司已收到两家公司的收购建议，其中包括美国投资公司 KKR & Co.。【原文：Japanese chemical manufacturer Taiyo Holdings Co. has received acquisition proposals from two companies including US investment firm KKR & Co., according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 新西兰第六次降息推动经济复苏
item.description: 新西兰央行连续第六次降息，并表示仍有进一步降息的空间，以促进受美国关税影响的经济复苏。【原文：New Zealand’s central bank cut interest rates for a sixth straight meeting and signaled it has scope for further reductions to bolster an economic recovery that’s been clouded by US tariffs.】

item.title: 贸易停战后经济学家对中国通货紧缩的担忧加深
item.description: 经济学家预计，中国的通货紧缩压力将进一步加剧，尽管在与美国的贸易战休战之后，他们提高了对今年经济增长和出口的预测。【原文：Economists expect deflationary pressure to get worse in China, even as they improve forecasts for growth and exports this year after a truce in the trade war with the US.】

item.title: 澳大利亚月度 CPI 高于预期，澳元走高
item.description: 澳大利亚 4 月份的月度通胀率略高于预期，与此同时，关税动荡扰乱了市场，促使储备银行上周降低了利率。【原文：A gauge of Australia’s monthly inflation came in slightly faster than expected in April, coinciding with a period of tariff turmoil that roiled markets and encouraged the Reserve Bank to lower interest rates last week.】

item.title: 中行吹捧华尔街实习生存款 100 万美元
item.description: 在利率下行的背景下，中国各家银行都在争夺存款，其中一家贷款机构采取了一种新颖的方式来赢得业务：它为存款超过 100 万美元的家庭提供帮助，确保他们在美国一些最大的公司以及华尔街银行实习。【原文：As Chinese banks battle for deposits amid sinking interest rates, one lender, briefly, took a novel approach to win business: It offered help in securing internships at some of the nation’s biggest companies as well as Wall Street banks for families who put in more than $1 million.】

item.title: 花旗买入印度债券，因其利率政策与美国不同
item.description: 据花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.【原文：The rally in Indian bonds is set to extend as the nation embarks on deeper interest-rate cuts, diverging from the US, according to Citigroup Inc.】

item.title: 零售商抢购大米，日本暂停库存销售
item.description: 在看到零售商的快速反应后，日本暂停出售大米储备，这是政府在今年夏天大选前努力平抑飙升的大米价格、缓解消费者对生活成本担忧的一个积极迹象。【原文：Japan paused its sale of rice reserves after seeing a fast response from retailers, in a positive sign for the government’s efforts to temper soaring rice prices and ease consumers’ cost-of-living concerns ahead of an election this summer.】

item.title: 百度支持的人工智能 3D 游戏创企 Seele 寻求新融资
item.description: Seele Inc.在11月从百度公司的投资部门和美图公司牵头的投资者那里筹集到资金后，正在以数亿美元的估值寻求新的资金。【原文：Seele Inc. is seeking fresh capital at a valuation of several hundred million dollars after raising funds from investors led by Baidu Inc.’s investment arm and Meitu Inc. in November.】

item.title: 美联储威廉姆斯称大流行病改变了通胀观念
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行行长约翰-威廉姆斯（John Williams）说，大流行病时期的价格冲击改变了美国消费者对通货膨胀的看法，政策制定者不能想当然地认为人们对未来价格上涨的估计将保持不变。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of New York President John Williams said pandemic-era price shocks changed American consumers’ inflation perceptions, and policymakers can’t take for granted that people’s estimates of future price increases will remain anchored.】

item.title: 中国顶级大宗商品交易所计划对外国人全面开放
item.description: 中国最大的商品期货市场表示，计划将其业务国际化，允许海外投资者全面参与其产品交易。【原文：China’s biggest commodities futures market said it plans to internationalize its operations and allow overseas investors full access to trade its products.】

item.title: 瑞银集团可汗认为客户对另类资产需求旺盛
item.description: 瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）亚太区主管表示，该集团的富裕客户正在寻求购买更多另类资产，因为他们希望在市场和全球贸易动荡时期实现投资多样化。【原文：Wealthy customers of UBS Group AG are looking to buy more alternative assets as they seek to diversify investments during a volatile period for markets and global trade, according to the firm’s Asia Pacific chief.】

item.title: 投资者缺乏信心，中国股市陷入困境
item.description: 在近期的全球市场波动中，中国股市明显表现平静，因为在关税和国内刺激政策明朗之前，投资者选择保持观望。【原文：Chinese stocks have been notably calm during the recent bout of global market volatility, as investors opt to stay on the sidelines until there is clarity on tariffs and domestic stimulus.】

item.title: 黄金跌后走高，关注美国数据和贸易谈判
item.description: 尽管有数据显示经济景气有所改善，贸易谈判也有取得进展的迹象，但市场仍处于观望状态。【原文：Gold edged higher after a two-day decline, as the market remained in wait-and-see mode in spite of data showing improving economic sentiment and signs of progress in trade talks.】

item.title: 达里奥不会加入印尼基金担任顾问，这是对普拉博沃的打击
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，雷-达里奥（Ray Dalio）不会担任印尼新主权财富基金达纳塔拉（Danantara）的顾问。【原文：Ray Dalio won’t be an adviser to Indonesia’s new sovereign wealth fund Danantara, people familiar with the matter said, just two months after officials announced the billionaire’s involvement.】

item.title: 支撑人民币数月后，中国寻求减缓人民币升势
item.description: 美元的持续下滑促使中国央行改变了管理本国货币的方式，从支持人民币转向防范快速升值的风险。【原文：The dollar’s extended slide has prompted China’s central bank to change tack in managing its currency, as it pivots from supporting the yuan to guarding against the risk of a rapid appreciation.】

item.title: 交易商权衡供应前景和俄罗斯制裁，石油价格保持稳定
item.description: 由于市场在欧佩克+供应增加的前景和美国对俄罗斯实施更多制裁的前景之间权衡，石油价格趋于稳定。【原文：Oil steadied as the market juggled the outlook for more OPEC+ supply and the prospect for additional US sanctions on Russia.】

item.title: 风险加剧，韩国央行准备在大选前降息
item.description: 人们普遍预计韩国央行将在周四，也就是关键的总统大选前几天下调基准利率，因为韩国央行将加大力度保护萎靡不振的经济免受主要来自唐纳德-特朗普关税的风险。【原文：The Bank of Korea is widely expected to lower its benchmark interest rate Thursday, just days ahead of a pivotal presidential election, as the central bank steps up its efforts to shield a sputtering economy from risks stemming largely from Donald Trump’s tariffs.】

item.title: 收益率暴跌后，交易员为日本 40 年期债券销售做好准备
item.description: 本周三，日本将拍卖 40 年期国债，投资者对此惶恐不安，因为该国收益率的波动继续在全球债务市场上肆虐。【原文：Investors are on tenterhooks Wednesday for an auction of 40-year Japanese government bonds as volatility in the nation’s yields continues to rumble through global debt markets.】

item.title: ARK、安联国际欲通过主动型 ETF 发掘台湾零售业热潮
item.description: 在台湾金融产品创新法规放宽的鼓励下，包括安联全球投资公司（Allianz Global Investors）和凯茜-伍德（Cathie Wood）的 ARK 投资管理公司（ARK Investment Management）在内的全球资产管理公司正竞相涌入台湾的零售投资热潮。【原文：Global asset managers including Allianz Global Investors and Cathie Wood’s ARK Investment Management are racing to ride Taiwan’s retail investing boom, encouraged by easing of regulations around financial-product innovation.】

item.title: 联昌国际称马来西亚资产将因基金削减美国风险敞口而获利
item.description: 联昌国际集团控股有限公司（CIMB Group Holdings Bhd）的一位高管表示，如果特朗普政府的破坏性贸易政策引发美国资产进一步下挫，马来西亚最终可能成为新兴市场的最大受益者之一。【原文：Malaysia could end up among the biggest beneficiaries in emerging markets if the Trump administration’s disruptive trade policies trigger a further selloff in US assets, according to a top executive at CIMB Group Holdings Bhd.】

item.title: 特朗普称房利美和房地美作为公共公司将继续获得美国担保
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统表示，即使在他寻求抵押贷款巨头房利美（Fannie Mae）和房地美（Freddie Mac）公开募股的同时，政府仍将保留对这两家公司的担保和监督职能。【原文：President Donald Trump said the government would retain guarantees and an oversight role over Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac even as he pursues a public offering for the mortgage giants.】

item.title: 野村因股东更名提议面临罕见表决
item.description: 随着美国股市激进主义的升温，野村控股公司收到了一份股东提案，该公司将在下个月的股东大会上对该提案进行 13 年来首次投票表决。【原文：Nomura Holdings Inc. has received a shareholder proposal that it will put to a vote for the first time in 13 years at a general meeting next month, as activism in the nation’s stock market heats up.】

item.title: 乐观情绪助推华尔街，亚洲股市将上涨：市场综述
item.description: 由于美国消费者信心回升、全球贸易谈判加速以及全球债券大涨等因素提振了市场情绪，亚洲股市将追随华尔街两周多来的最大涨势。【原文：Stocks in Asia were set to track the biggest rally on Wall Street in more than two weeks as sentiment was boosted by a rebound in US consumer confidence, an acceleration of global trade talks and a global surge in bonds.】

item.description:

item.title: 英国将在推动住房建设过程中减少小型建筑商的规划障碍
item.description: 英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）表示，英国政府将减少小型住宅建筑商面临的规划障碍，以实现其建造 150 万套新住宅的目标。【原文：The UK government said it would cut back planning hurdles faced by smaller housebuilders, as Prime Minister Keir Starmer seeks to deliver on his target of building 1.5 million new homes.】

item.title: 摩托罗拉同意以 44 亿美元收购无线电制造商 Silvus
item.description: 摩托罗拉解决方案公司（Motorola Solutions Inc.【原文：Motorola Solutions Inc. has agreed to buy closely held wireless-radio maker Silvus Technologies Inc. from TJC for $4.4 billion in its second-biggest acquisition.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会反垄断审判结束，Meta 的未来取决于法官
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc. 已在法庭上竭尽全力反击美国联邦贸易委员会对其垄断行为的指控。现在要由联邦法官来决定是否应该解散该公司。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. has done all it can in court to fight back at the US Federal Trade Commission’s claims that it’s a monopoly. Now it’s up to a federal judge to decide whether the company should be broken up.】

item.title: 乌拉圭将关键利率维持在 9.25%，强化紧缩政策立场
item.description: 乌拉圭中央银行将其关键利率维持在 9.25%，表明紧缩的货币政策将在未来一年内减缓通货膨胀，使其达到目标。【原文：Uruguay’s central bank held its key interest rate at 9.25%, signaling that tight monetary policy will slow inflation to target over the next year.】

item.title: 生物技术公司首次公开募股低迷，回报率令人失望，预计将持续到 2026 年
item.description: 药品开发商预计要到明年才会全面回归美国股市；由于生物技术只能给投资者带来微薄的回报，因此落后于其他行业。【原文：Drug developers aren’t expected to come back to the US equity markets in full force until next year — lagging other industries as biotechnology has delivered only subpar investor returns.】

item.title: 特朗普的国土安全部请求最高法院介入驱逐案
item.description: 特朗普政府要求美国最高法院阻止一项法官命令，该命令要求政府在将人们驱逐到所谓的第三国之前给予他们通知和反对的机会。【原文：The Trump administration asked the US Supreme Court to block a judge’s order that requires the government to give people notice and an opportunity to object before they are deported to a so-called third country.】
